channel.title: Rubber History on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Rubber History on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Bend, Don’t Break
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: Modern hair combs are unusually simple tools—perhaps our simplest. Their single row of bristles, usually black, are designed to do one thing—separate and organize your hair follicles into a more attractive format. They do this effectively, without the need of any electricity. And they’re cheap, too—you never have one when you need one, but you can buy a pack of 72 of them for eight bucks, or 11 cents each.
